header.title: Birit Vuolab válljejuvvui báikenammaprošeavtta koordináhtorin - Sámi Siida rs

list.p:
Arkiiva
Beavdegirjjit
Doaibmaplánat
Doaibmamuitalusat
Almmuhuheamit ja earát

body.p: Registrere epoastačujuhusa vuostáiváldit ođasreivve ja dieđu go giinu cealká.
Sámi Siidda stivra mearridii čoahkkimistis cuoŋománu 4. beaivve váljet Birit Vuolab báikenammaprošeavtta prošeaktakoordináhtorin. Bargu bistá dán jagi lohpii.
Prošeavtta ulbmilin lea čoaggit ja sirdit báikenamaid. Báikenamat leat dehálaš oassi báikkálaš sámekultuvra ja danin ferte sihkkarastot ahte namat seilot ja leat geavahusas vel boahtte buolvvainge.

Prošeakta jurdda lea boahtan Lávvonjárgalaš Yngve Johansen báikenammaprošeavttas, gos son čoggii Rákkonjárgga báikenamaid ja sirddii daid interaktiivvalaš CD-Romii. CD-Rom lea gávdnomis ee. Ohcejoga girjerádjosis namain "Rákkonjárga".

ROFL! Joanna, I got excited about the conetst and then read the comments and fell apart with laughter at your quandary with the rating system. LOL! This is a wonderful idea and Lea will be a wonderful judge. I"ll have to put my thinking cap on for this one. Thanks for always inspiring us to write Joanna!Karen xx

Lea Ann,Christmas is for the kids right??We do a cousins gift enxcahge (pull names so if you have 3 kids then all you buy is 3 gifts). As for the adults we play a white elephant style game.Nothing is to be bought, you have to find something laying around the house that is not TRASH but something you just don"t want or use.You wrap it up in a bag or box as pretty as can be to make it more appealing to someone else =)All the adults are handed a card from a deck, then the dealer has a different deck to pull from. As your card is called you go look at all the pretty boxes and bags and pick what one you want (cant open this round). After all the cards have been called and all the boxes/bags have been taken you do another round, this is the steal round , you go trade someone your bag for their bag then you open it, show it off and put it back in the bag/box after all cards are gone you do the last round where it gets FUN =)You have to remember what was in each bag/box and trade with someone if you want what they have, if you want to keep what you have then you just say keep . The object of the game in the last round is to be the last card called so you have the ultimate pick =)Good Luck!! Becky

Good ideas.Yeah, a lot of glitter on the make-ups lately. It’s nice, I love heavy make-up, but pink isn’t your color in my opinion. Purple, black and wine red would be more suited to you. But as you say, it indeed depends a lot on the oufants.Thtiks for the follow ups, always appreciated

It"s good to see this group reaching out to the pliubc with a presentation. Based on what I have seen on this blog, and the CIMA website, there is quite a bit of good factual information for consumers. Hope many groups take you up on the offer to learn more about the value of insulation to saving energy and the environment.

Can’t wait to try this egg salad. I love making left-over pork sandwiches. The pork has been cooked in the crockpot w/dry mustard, garlic, chieccn/rike soup & a couple of other things. It’s a good meal, but the left-overs are better!

Nu am eencercat sÄƒ fac bereta Lolita. La re2ndul Rc5 scrie aÅŸa: luc. 1 oc. l., *1 p.sc. een firacee din urm. oc.*, rep. de la * la * de eencÄƒ 6 ori, 1 p.sc. een firacee din urm. 6 p.m. ÅŸi term. cu 1 oc. al. een primul oc.l. Sunt 56 p.sc.DacÄƒ eenÅ£eleg eu, nedumerirea ta este unde anume se realizeazÄƒ creÅŸterea, deoarece la finalul re2ndului Rc4 sunt 48 p.m., iar fÄƒrÄƒ nicio creÅŸtere een Rc5, la finalul re2ndului sunt 56 p.sc. cen varianta italianÄƒ scrie aÅŸa: "5 g.: lav. 1 cat., * 1 m. bs. inciascuna delle 5 m. alte seg., 2 m. bs.nella seg. m. *,rip. da * a * per altre 6volte, 1 m. bs. in ciascuna delle sego6 m. alte e term. con 1 m. bss. nella 1cat. Si hanno 56 m. bs." ÅŸi am eencercat sÄƒ traduc. Astfel, "lavora 1 catenella, * 1 maglia bassa in ciascuna delle 5 maglie alte seguenti, 2 maglie bassa nella seguenti maglie *, ripeti da * a * per altre 6 volte, 1 maglia bassa in ciascuna delle sego 6 maglie alte e termina con 1 maglia bassissima nella 1 catenella. Si hanno 56 maglie bassa." Traducerea corecta ar fi aceasta, deci: "lucraÅ£i 1 ochi lÄƒnÅ£iÅŸor, * 1 picior scurt een firacee din urmÄƒtoarele 5 picioruÅŸe mari, 2 picioruÅŸe scurte een urmÄƒtorul picioruÅŸ mare*, repetaÅ£i de la * la * de eencÄƒ 6 ori, 1 picioruÅŸ scurt een firacee din urmÄƒtoarele 6 picioruÅŸe mari ÅŸi terminaÅ£i cu 1 ochi alunecat een primul ochi lÄƒnÅ£iÅŸor. Sunt 56 picioruÅŸe scurte." Sper sÄƒ te ajute. Am scris boldat partea lipsÄƒ din varianta een limba rome2nÄƒ. GreÅŸealÄƒ din grabÄƒ cel mai probabil...

Roy Halladay throws 2nd poesssaton no hitter, after Don Larsen in 56. Jamie Moyer was in the dugout for both. Impossible to hate the guy! Man, I would LOVE to hear what Don Larsen has to say about Halladay"s no-hitter tonight. Phillies MLB.

Don"t count your chickens yet Mr. Prof Larry. Still 10 vriotices to achieve.Watching Halladay"s no-hitter was like being an eyewitness to DaVinci painting the Mona Lisa or The Last Supper. Welcome to baseball"s version of Masterpiece Theater.The Reds looked like doomed men at the guillotine during the French Revolution meeting their fate one after another. They had no chance of survival. Heads rolled, and I loved it. Best individual athletic performance from a Phila. athlete ever.

Is it possible that the # of post seaosn no hitters as a % of total post seaosn games played (2 out of 1245) is actually lower (I think) than the # of perfect games as a % of total major league games ever played (20 out of a damn lot)? Someone do the math please-it"s giving me a smashing headache.

Thanks for the input Melissa and thanks for your surpopt! Balancing parenthood and creative/professional life is a topic that is CONSTANTLY on my mind! Balancing work and creativity is also an interesting challenge. The balancing act is tricky and I think that we can manage it best by being clear about our priorities . Can"t wait to write more about that one! I love your question as to how to write an effective bio/blurb as well. It is definitely challenging writing about ourselves although I think that you do an extraordinary job presenting yourself!*Melissa has just signed a contract to publish her first YA fiction novel!* Her book is absolutely brilliant! I am hoping that Melissa will do some guest posting for me because she knows how to make dreams come true!!xo Lea

I hear you all. Today, I recently revcieed this email from UK WEB:*******Dear XXXAs you probably know, UK WEB has ceased trading. You deserve some answers.It is with great regret that this occurred. Despite best efforts early in the year, we failed to serve our customers. Let alone Legendary Service that we once strived for.The remains of the hosting business was transfered to Heart Internet who will honour all of the hosting and most of domain accounts and expiry dates. Heart Internet are a very trust worthy, well funded and successful company and we know that they will do their best to help you.If you are one of the customers who have domain names with GoDaddy please send an email to We will transfer each and every domain to it"s rightful owner. Whilst I can"t guarantee a same day reply due to the volume of emails I will work on them every evening to help out all of you as best that I can.To those that held a hosting account during 2007, you will feel strongly let down and with good cause. You had become accustomed to a high level of service that we could not sustain. We worked hard to repair the damage that we bought into but in the end personal and financial circumstances meant that it fell into disrepair.To be fair to the previous owners, they must have encountered the same and we naively believed that we could rebuild and grow. We didn"t have the finances to weather the storms and we collapsed under the weight of it.Once again, you have our deepest apologises for the appalling services these last few months and wish you the very best with Heart Internet, or your new provider.*******Might be hogwash. I"ve not got my domain back. Ill report back to let you all know.

Self-imposed deadlines are a great idea I"d hang arnoud on social media all day without them!Having the same challenge as you own blog posts a bit thin on the ground as I juggle other projects including launching that new web site I mentioned. Aiming for December now but possibly January.I very much like the way you respect your readers by leaving short updates like this one always look forward to the latest news from you.

Hi Melissa! Welcome to the wonderful world of real esatte! That"s a great question for you to ask your RE Teacher. Also, are you planning on working with a large re company or an independent? My suggestion is start off with a business plan. Notify your sphere of influence .tell your family, friends, neighbors, so they will tell their family, friends, neighbors, etc., send out announcement cards, then follow up with phone calls to your sphere. Word of mouth is the best advertising and it"s free. Try to get a listing so you can meet buyers. If you can"t get a listing soon, offer to do as many open houses for other agents as you can. Get out there and network. Go after expireds and fsbo"s. Have many things going on at a time because wasting time means there"s a gap between paychecks. I have quite a few active buyers right now, some I have just recently met and others I have been showing properties to for the past 4 to 5 months and some longer. Anyway, typically, 45 days to closing and then you get paid. Good Luck .any questions, feel free to email!

John: FTTP = Fibre To the Premises. Same as FTTH, but avoids the implication that homes are the only buildings who have fixed-line tenenommucicatiols installed.As distinct from (FTTN) Fibre To the Node, which is an alternative cheaper but slower proposal discussed in other LP posts.

John: FTTP = Fibre To the Premises. Same as FTTH, but avoids the implication that homes are the only buildings who have fixed-line tenenommucicatiols installed.As distinct from (FTTN) Fibre To the Node, which is an alternative cheaper but slower proposal discussed in other LP posts.

WOW!!! I am not even sure i knew that this existed! Brooke you did great! (Thanks for miakng me look taller than amber on the pic where we are standing on the poles! haha) It was a pleasure having you take our pictures. I HATE getting my picture taken (i am a guy what can i say!) but having you take our pictures was FUN! I am not just saying that b/c i am on your blog i really mean it! You the only person that has ever made taking picture fun for me! I have a beautiful wife and your a great photographer and that equals great pictures!!! Thanks again!
